title: Excessive VO frequency on new releases is really starting to annoy me (Kinda constructive (?))
body:
So, with recent releases I've come to notice a pattern where these new champions, coincidentally mostly female, have an overbearing frequency of voice-lines/grunts/moans that can be extremely annoying when playing against.

It started with Caitlyn's BOOM Headshot, and Taliyah's THROW ANOTHER ROCK but the most recent champion that really annoys me is Irelia.

Wanna know why?
SHE MOANS ON LITERALLY EVERY AUTO ATTACK. 
This leads to whoever plays against her to be assaulted by high pitched yelling and screams that can be extremely infuriating to put up with.

And here's the sad part.
These champions have GREAT VO.
Taliyah in particular has such a genuine, sweet VO but the enemy never gets to hear that.
Instead they get the same sound over and over and over and over and over again and it leads to these champions being really annoying in the sound department.

So, here's a question.
Can't riot just tone down the VO frequency when playing against these champions so those of us who play with maxed out voices can enjoy the game without wanting to tear their hair out?

Please, it's really getting on my nerves.

//Rant

replies.body:
Ironically,  i believe what your describing is not VO but SFX.  
Often called “efforts” these sound fx are frequently tied to animations (rather than the gameplay triggers VO is attached to) .     

 BUT if you can be more specific it’s more helpful.   —name exactly the champion, skin, the action she/he/it are taking that triggers the sound, and suggest potential solves (lower volume, lower frequency, or wrong performance).   

We do listen to this sort of feedback— and when we have bandwith adjust stuff (Unless something is already in a VGU)

Ah, well, that might explain a thing or two.

The most recent example is Irelia, which is the worst offender in my books simply because she has "efforts" whenever she auto attacks.
Which is frankly...A lot...seeing that she's a champion that uses a ton of auto attacks.

Another one is Taliyah, which also comes from the frequency of her Q, which is a mere 3 seconds at max rank, without CDR.

I feel high frequency attacks should not always play a sound queue since they happen so often and kinda become repetitive and annoying.

Compare that to Taric's stun, which is a single use, high impact spell, and you get to cherish these VO lines.
As for Irelia: I'm kinda glad though that when she makes such swing, it does sound like she puts in effort. I saw Tennis players doing less and screaming louder.
TFW your roommate turns on tennis and you are in the other room.

There's a joke.
They make interview with an old neighbour of famous tennis player and ask her If she doesn't mind the moaning when her neighbour trains.
And she's like: ,,Not really... But why does she need to train at midnight?"

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=v1gbixkd,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-04-12T16:11:07.881+0000)
>
> Ironically,  i believe what your describing is not VO but SFX.  
> Often called “efforts” these sound fx are frequently tied to animations (rather than the gameplay triggers VO is attached to) .     
> 
>  BUT if you can be more specific it’s more helpful.   —name exactly the champion, skin, the action she/he/it are taking that triggers the sound, and suggest potential solves (lower volume, lower frequency, or wrong performance).   
> 
> We do listen to this sort of feedback— and when we have bandwith adjust stuff (Unless something is already in a VGU)

Honestly, the best kind of advice to give on this is that if you feel the need to add voice lines, or SFX to specific champion abilities, especially those on low cooldowns, you need to make sure there's a large number of them to prevent them getting annoying. That, or make sure they don't play on EVERY cast of that ability. 

Personally, I've found myself rather annoyed by certain voice lines that champions keep spouting, too. The worst offender being Twitch. I -hate- having him in my games. I get it Twitch, you were hiding. I got it the last seven fucking times, too, just fuck off already. Oh noes, something that won't wash off, that'll go well with the fifty other things that didn't wash off either. He's horrible, and I honestly wish there was an option to turn off lines like that, because he repeats them over and over and over, and there's so few lines for each ability that you end up hearing each and every one what feels like hundreds of times just doing laning phase alone. 
Just... make it stop, please. His rework was great, but his voice lines is making me hate him which is a damned shame. :(

Also, as others have mentioned; Cait's headshot lines. Same problem as with Twitch. I tend to notice it more on her time traveling skin thingy more than the original one. CRANIUM BLAST! BRAIN HOLE! Just... stop.

I would suggest making Vigar’s W less subtle. It’s may be the hardest skill to detect both visually and audio-ly (?) and yet it deals a whole lot of damage. It’s particularly hard to identify in chaotic team fights.
Ekko. I hate Ekko having effort SFX on EVERY spell cast and auto, especially as an enemy facing off against him.
I'd throw Trundle into the mix but that's more lack of variation on move to VO lines combined with "shouty" lines getting old in a hurry.

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=v1gbixkd,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-04-12T16:11:07.881+0000)
>
> Ironically,  i believe what your describing is not VO but SFX.  
> Often called “efforts” these sound fx are frequently tied to animations (rather than the gameplay triggers VO is attached to) .     
> 
>  BUT if you can be more specific it’s more helpful.   —name exactly the champion, skin, the action she/he/it are taking that triggers the sound, and suggest potential solves (lower volume, lower frequency, or wrong performance).   
> 
> We do listen to this sort of feedback— and when we have bandwith adjust stuff (Unless something is already in a VGU)

Pulsefire Caitlyn. My fiancee hesitates to use the skin after buying it because her voice lines occur way too frequently. I just asked him and he said ''Just farming a wave with auto attacks you will hear 6 different voice lines''

If you're opening the floor to sound complaints:

Love Tap on GGMF (it's worst on skin 4) has this a brief tinny, mechanical fingernails-on-chalkboard sound. My husband and I play on computers in the same room, and we both stopped using the skin because of how irritating the sound is.

"Irritating" isn't quite the right adjective, though. A cricket in your house is irritating. This is more like a trickle sound you can't find or the sound of metal against teeth; it just triggers an overwhelming urge to *make it stop.*

> [{quoted}](name=Vekkna,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=v1gbixkd,comment-id=00020003,timestamp=2018-04-12T18:31:45.071+0000)
>
> If you're opening the floor to sound complaints:
> 
> Love Tap on GGMF (it's worst on skin 4) has this a brief tinny, mechanical fingernails-on-chalkboard sound. My husband and I play on computers in the same room, and we both stopped using the skin because of how irritating the sound is.
> 
> "Irritating" isn't quite the right adjective, though. A cricket in your house is irritating. This is more like a trickle sound you can't find or the sound of metal against teeth; it just triggers an overwhelming urge to *make it stop.*

I haven't had your problem on the GGMF skin, but there is a nice crisp love tap sound effect on her pool party skin if you want to try that

>SHE MOANS ON LITERALLY EVERY AUTO ATTACK.

Realistically speaking, shouldn't moaning on every AA be Evelynn's thing?
Listening to Eve's voice lines again and LUL she's such a thot xd
I'm glad I know I'm not the only one that is annoyed with Taliyah's "Throw another rock!" line. It's especially frustrating to hear it all the time in ARAM.

Did... did you not play against old Irelia? She would yell while doing Q, say this weird "hghn" line whenever she used E, and yell even more while casting R. Except she had a very small set of lines and effects so you heard the same series of battlecries throughout the entire game. I personally _love_ the new militant personality they've injected into Irelia, and think that the rift would feel a lot more alive if characters reacted a bit more dynamically rather than have all their lines only played to the summoner, or during taunts. Imo this new direction is amazing and I hope we reach a level of character interaction close to DOTA 2 eventually.

I think it had started with Azir, actually, where the enemy players basically only hear him yelling "ONWARD" and "TRUST IN ME" non stop for the entire game.

But then while that can be annoying, there's also Rakan and Xayah who are on the complete opposite of that spectrum where they chatter way too much across way too many things, and so you just want them to shut up instead.

Riot needs to control the lines available to the opponent so it's not always either complete barebones 2 lines repeated for eternity or its exact opposite.
